answers.answer: I knew you meant briefcase.  Just giving you a hard time.  I've also read people that lousey/tired preceded relapse.  In my expereince that was not the case.  After fist tx, I felt great and back to pre-tx normal.  Not sure if was euphoria for making it through , the onset of a new spring and thought that I had kicked C, or what ever.  I felt good.  Then, the word of relapse.  I don't think you can feel relapse.  But, look at recent history in your life.  The tragedy in your family, the continued recovery for 48 weeks of junk, probably stepping it up a couple of notches at work, wearing heavy boots,  probably not in the best endurance conditiion, colder weather requiring more from your body's engine and a bunch of other things maybe.  You get a pcr in about 2 weeks.  Until then I'd suggest getting rest, getting some fresh air and exercise and seeing what you can do about that diet.  Let the chips fall in a few weeks, premature worry is sapping in many ways.
Or, if the 'need to know' is a draining factor on your psyche now, see if you can get the pcr early.

Your diet may be the cause of your feeling tired now, sugar can wear out your adrenals and pancreas. I only treated once and 9 weeks post tx. now and I feel fine, but I have had over 12 hours of bodywork and 10 sauna baths. My diet is very good. Be careful you don't get diabetes with all that sugar. Your car doesn't run well on crummy gas, likewise your body doesn't run well on junk food. Best wishes to you.
OK - you have put the fear of God in me. The last thing I want is any other complications. Just thru out my last two Pepperidge farms Ginger Man cookies and ordered a salad for lunch!!!!!!!

I'm so glad you had that salad. I'm sure you will feel better as your diet improves. Then you will be SVR and you will REALLY feel good. I never want to feel as bad as I did on tx. Two friends of mine got diabetes following tx. It is NO fun.Fl guy said many good things, especially about premature worry can sap your energy. Have a wonderful holiday. We have SO much to be thankful for. Take good care.
I finished in September, and I'm still tired.  Not that awful fatigue, but not as good as I'd like to feel.  I'm hoping it just takes some time.FlGal

I think its normal. Although it did not take to long to feel better the fatigue lingered for a while.In fact when I first ended tx the fatigue was worse for a couple weeks. I figured it was the lack of riba.Anyway after about a month or two it was much better. I am 5 months post and fatigue is gone.Hang in there, it gets much better.
That is great news to hear the fatigue goes away in time. Hope everyone has a happy holiday.

I did the tx in 2004, relapser, geno 3.  Fatigue has been a big part of my life since the early 90s (didnt know what was wrong, not diagnosed at that time).  Before, during and after tx the fatigue has not gone, still suffering to this day.After negotiations by AHCS with a company called All In One Nutrition, they have marketted a product called Hep C Complete, they kindly dropped the price down from $29.95US to $19.95US to help people with hepatitis C afford it, 60 tablets containing Selenium, Milk Thistle and Alpha Lipoic Acid.Ive been trialling it for 9 weeks now, and there is a big difference in my fatigue, I no longer just lie on the couch resting whenever I could, I am more active and have lots more energy.  I am not marketing this product, Im just letting you know what I have come across and how it is working for me.As I am trialling it, I will stop taking it in another week, stop for a 2-3 weeks, see how I am feeling, then go on it again and monitor.  But so far there is a remarkable difference.I am also involved in researching fatigue at this time, its been a long process getting all the studies but it is coming along.  When it is finished I will post the findings.The All In One Nutrition website is at:http://allinone-nutrition.com
To read on the Hep C Complete go to this link:http://www.hepcaustralia.com.au/latest-news/hep-c-complete-3.html

question: Hello FLGuy - Always happy to see you. - in my last post meant briefcase LOL - I do have a concern. Since last weekend I have been feeling very tired.  I remember reading here someone knew thathad relapsed by the return of that Hep C tired feeling. I am a little scared. I don't know if I have felt this all along and haven;t noticed because of everything that had been going on. Has anyone else experienced this?  I am 2 months post tx. My hgb was 13 last dr visit. Have gained back at least 5lbs. Look much better. My diet is horrible. Since tx I have become a sugar addict. Pop tarts, cookies, cereal, anything sweet. That was all I could tolerate while on tx and haven't stopped since.
title: FLGuy/All - Feeling Tired Post Tx
